page.title: 05RECREATION - HOBBIES, CLUBS
page.content: MOST PEOPLE LIKE GARDENING OR FISHING OR MACHINE KNITTING. CHILDREN PLAY FOOTBALL AND NETBALL; SOME CHILDREN PLAY TENNIS OR DO GYMNASTICS. WE HAVE GROUPS OF BROWNIES, CUBS, GUIDES AND SCOUTS, A PLAY-GROUP, A YOUTH GROUP AND MEMBERS OF A PIPE BAND. THE ADULTS HAVE THE W.R.I. (WOMEN'S RURAL INSTITUTE), THE CHURCH GUILD, A DARTS CLUB AND SOME BOWLING. THERE IS A MOBILE LIBRARY FOR THOSE WHO ENJOY READING. JOGGING IS POPULAR, MANY PEOPLE HAVE PETS AND EVERYONE ENJOYS WATCHING TELEVISION. SOMEONE KEEPS FERRETS FOR CATCHING RABBITS. ROOKS AND PIGEONS ARE SOMETIMES PESTS AND ARE SHOT TO KEEP THEIR NUMBERS DOWN. THE ROYAL OBSERVER CORPS MEET REGULARLY AND DISCUSS MATTERS OF NATIONAL DEFENCE. FOR THEATRES, CINEMAS, CONCERTS AND MUSEUMS, EDINBURGH IS THE NEAREST CENTRE.
